headline: United Air surges with Q1 beat, invests in growth 'aggressively'
summary: United Airlines (UAL) stock is surging after the company beat estimates for its first quarter earnings. Peter McNally, Third Bridge global head of sector analysts, joins Asking for a Trend to discuss the earnings report and explain why United's strategy is conducive to growth. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

headline: United Gives Two Profit Scenarios: ‘Impossible to Predict’
summary: United Airlines offered two sets of profit guidance Tuesday depending on whether the U.S. enters a recession or not. "The company's outlook is dependent on the macro environment which the company believes is impossible to predict this year with any degree of confidence," United said in an investor update.

headline: United Airlines (NASDAQ:UAL) Exceeds Q1 Expectations, Stock Soars
summary: Airline company United Airlines Holdings (NASDAQ:UAL) reported Q1 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5.4% year on year to $13.21 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.91 per share was 23.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: United Airlines warns of profit risks if US economy falters
summary: CHICAGO (Reuters) -United Airlines forecast lower-than-expected profit for the current quarter on Tuesday and warned of downside risks to its full-year outlook if the U.S. economy slips into a recession.  President Donald Trump's trade war has increased the odds of an economic recession, hitting business and consumer confidence and rattling global markets.  United said its financial forecast is dependent on the macro environment, which, it added, is "impossible to predict this year with any degree of confidence."

raw.headline: United Airlines warns of profit risks if US economy falters
raw.summary: CHICAGO (Reuters) -United Airlines forecast lower-than-expected profit for the current quarter on Tuesday and warned of downside risks to its full-year outlook if the U.S. economy slips into a recession.  President Donald Trump's trade war has increased the odds of an economic recession, hitting business and consumer confidence and rattling global markets.  United said its financial forecast is dependent on the macro environment, which, it added, is "impossible to predict this year with any degree of confidence."

headline: United: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: CHICAGO (AP) — United Airlines Holdings Inc. UAL) on Tuesday reported first-quarter earnings of $387 million. The Chicago-based company said it had profit of $1.16 per share.

headline: Travel Stocks Are No Ticket to Paradise
summary: Overseas visitor numbers fell by 11.6%, with European arrivals dropping sharply.  ✈️ The picture has darkened close enough to the quarterly “quiet period” that many travel-related companies have yet to quantify the impact, but airlines Delta and Frontier pulled financial guidance.

headline: Earnings Insight: Oil Refiners See Sharp Declines To Q1 Estimates
summary: Energy companies are facing a double headwind: proposed tariffs that threaten to dampen demand, and an unexpected increase in OPEC production that could raise global supply.
